speaker: Elder Massimo De Feo
title: Rise! He Calleth Thee
paragraph_text: Some time ago I asked my wife, “Can you tell me why, as far as I remember, we have never had any major problems in our lives?”

speaker: Elder Massimo De Feo
title: Rise! He Calleth Thee
paragraph_text: She looked at me and said, “Sure. I’ll tell you why we have never had any major problems; it’s because you have a very short memory!”

speaker: Elder Massimo De Feo
title: Rise! He Calleth Thee
paragraph_text: Her quick and smart answer made me realize once again that living the gospel of Jesus Christ does not remove pain and trials, which are necessary to grow.

speaker: Elder Massimo De Feo
title: Rise! He Calleth Thee
paragraph_text: The gospel is not a way to avoid challenges and problems but a solution to increase our faith and learn how to deal with them.

speaker: Elder Massimo De Feo
title: Rise! He Calleth Thee
paragraph_text: I had a sense of this truth a few months ago when I was walking one day and suddenly my sight became blurry, dark, and wavy. I was scared. Then the doctors told me, “If you don’t begin treatment immediately, you may lose your sight even in a matter of weeks.” I was even more scared.

speaker: Elder Massimo De Feo
title: Rise! He Calleth Thee
paragraph_text: And then they said, “You need intravitreal injections—injections right in the eye, wide-open eye—every four weeks for the rest of your life.”

speaker: Elder Massimo De Feo
title: Rise! He Calleth Thee
paragraph_text: That was an uncomfortable wake-up call.

speaker: Elder Massimo De Feo
title: Rise! He Calleth Thee
paragraph_text: Then a reflection came in the form of a question. I asked myself, “OK! My physical sight is not good, but what about my spiritual vision? Do I need any treatment there? And what does it mean to have a clear spiritual vision?”

speaker: Elder Massimo De Feo
title: Rise! He Calleth Thee
paragraph_text: I pondered about the story of a blind man called Bartimaeus, described in the Gospel of Mark. The scripture says, “And when he heard that it was Jesus of Nazareth, he began to cry out, and say, Jesus, thou Son of David, have mercy on me.”

speaker: Elder Massimo De Feo
title: Rise! He Calleth Thee
paragraph_text: Technically, in the eyes of many, Jesus was just the son of Joseph, so why did Bartimaeus call Him “Son of David”? Simply because he recognized that Jesus was indeed the Messiah, who was prophesied to be born as a descendant of David.

speaker: Elder Massimo De Feo
title: Rise! He Calleth Thee
paragraph_text: It is interesting that this blind man, who didn’t have physical sight, recognized Jesus. He saw spiritually what he couldn’t see physically, while many others could see Jesus physically but were totally blind spiritually.

speaker: Elder Massimo De Feo
title: Rise! He Calleth Thee
paragraph_text: From this story we learn more about clear spiritual vision.

speaker: Elder Massimo De Feo
title: Rise! He Calleth Thee
paragraph_text: We read, “And many charged him that he should hold his peace: but he cried the more a great deal, Thou Son of David, have mercy on me.”

speaker: Elder Massimo De Feo
title: Rise! He Calleth Thee
paragraph_text: All around him were telling him to be quiet, but he cried out even more because he knew who Jesus really was. He ignored those voices and screamed even louder.

speaker: Elder Massimo De Feo
title: Rise! He Calleth Thee
paragraph_text: He acted instead of being acted upon. Despite his limited circumstances, he used his faith to go beyond his limitations.

speaker: Elder Massimo De Feo
title: Rise! He Calleth Thee
paragraph_text: So, the first principle we learn is we keep a clear spiritual vision when we focus on Jesus Christ and stay true to what we know to be true.

speaker: Elder Massimo De Feo
title: Rise! He Calleth Thee
paragraph_text: Brothers and sisters, to keep our spiritual sight intact, we need to decide not to listen to the voices of the world around us. In this confusing and confused world, we must stay faithful to what we know, faithful to our covenants, faithful in keeping the commandments and reaffirm our beliefs even stronger, like this man did. We need to cry even louder our testimony of the Lord to the world. This man knew Jesus, stayed faithful to what he believed, and was not distracted by the voices around him.

speaker: Elder Massimo De Feo
title: Rise! He Calleth Thee
paragraph_text: There are many voices today trying to lower our voices as disciples of Jesus Christ. The voices of the world are trying to silence us, but that’s exactly why we must declare our testimony of the Savior louder and stronger. Among all the voices of the world, the Lord is counting on me and you to declare our testimonies, to raise our voice, and to become His voice. If we don’t do it, who will testify of Jesus Christ? Who will speak His name and declare His divine mission?

speaker: Elder Massimo De Feo
title: Rise! He Calleth Thee
paragraph_text: We have a spiritual charge that comes from our knowledge of Jesus Christ.

speaker: Elder Massimo De Feo
title: Rise! He Calleth Thee
paragraph_text: But what did Bartimaeus do after that?

speaker: Elder Massimo De Feo
title: Rise! He Calleth Thee
paragraph_text: At the Lord’s command to rise , he acted again in faith.

speaker: Elder Massimo De Feo
title: Rise! He Calleth Thee
paragraph_text: The scripture says, “And he, casting away his garment, rose, and came to Jesus.”

speaker: Elder Massimo De Feo
title: Rise! He Calleth Thee
paragraph_text: This humble and faithful man understood that he could rise to a better life at Jesus’s command. He knew that he was better than his circumstances, and the very first thing he did when he heard Jesus calling him was to throw away his beggar’s coat.

speaker: Elder Massimo De Feo
title: Rise! He Calleth Thee
paragraph_text: Again he acted instead of being acted upon.

speaker: Elder Massimo De Feo
title: Rise! He Calleth Thee
paragraph_text: He might have thought, “I don’t need this anymore, now that Jesus has come into my life. This is a new day. I’m done with this life of misery. With Jesus I can start a new life of happiness and joy in Him, with Him, and through Him. And I don’t care what the world thinks of me. Jesus is calling me, and He will help me live a new life.”

speaker: Elder Massimo De Feo
title: Rise! He Calleth Thee
paragraph_text: What a remarkable change!

speaker: Elder Massimo De Feo
title: Rise! He Calleth Thee
paragraph_text: As he threw away his beggar’s coat, he got rid of all excuses.

speaker: Elder Massimo De Feo
title: Rise! He Calleth Thee
paragraph_text: And this is a second principle: we keep a clear spiritual vision when we leave the natural man behind, repent, and begin a new life in Christ.

speaker: Elder Massimo De Feo
title: Rise! He Calleth Thee
paragraph_text: The way to do it is by making and keeping covenants to rise to a better life through Jesus Christ.

speaker: Elder Massimo De Feo
title: Rise! He Calleth Thee
paragraph_text: As long as we make excuses to feel sorry for ourselves, sorry for our circumstances and problems, and sorry for all the bad things happening in our lives and even all the bad people who we think make us unhappy, we keep the beggar’s coat on our shoulders. It is true that at times people, consciously or not, hurt us. But we need to decide to act with faith in Christ by removing the mental and emotional coat that we might still wear to hide excuses or sin and throw it away, knowing that He can and will heal us.

speaker: Elder Massimo De Feo
title: Rise! He Calleth Thee
paragraph_text: There is never a good excuse to say, “I am the way I am because of some unfortunate and unpleasant circumstances. And I cannot change, and I am justified.”

speaker: Elder Massimo De Feo
title: Rise! He Calleth Thee
paragraph_text: When we think that way, we decide to be acted upon.

speaker: Elder Massimo De Feo
title: Rise! He Calleth Thee
paragraph_text: We keep the beggar’s coat.

speaker: Elder Massimo De Feo
title: Rise! He Calleth Thee
paragraph_text: Acting in faith means to rely on our Savior, believing that through His Atonement, we can rise above everything at His command.

speaker: Elder Massimo De Feo
title: Rise! He Calleth Thee
paragraph_text: The third principle is in the last four words: “[he] came to Jesus.”

speaker: Elder Massimo De Feo
title: Rise! He Calleth Thee
paragraph_text: How could he go to Jesus since he was blind? The only way was to walk toward Jesus by hearing His voice.

speaker: Elder Massimo De Feo
title: Rise! He Calleth Thee
paragraph_text: And this is a third principle: we keep a clear spiritual vision when we hear the voice of the Lord and allow Him to guide us.

speaker: Elder Massimo De Feo
title: Rise! He Calleth Thee
paragraph_text: Just as this man raised his voice over the voices around him, he was able to listen to the voice of the Lord in the middle of all other voices.

speaker: Elder Massimo De Feo
title: Rise! He Calleth Thee
paragraph_text: This is the same faith that allowed Peter to walk on water as long as he kept his spiritual focus on the Lord and was not distracted by the winds around him.

speaker: Elder Massimo De Feo
title: Rise! He Calleth Thee
paragraph_text: Then the story of this blind man ends with the words “he received his sight, and followed Jesus in the way.”

speaker: Elder Massimo De Feo
title: Rise! He Calleth Thee
paragraph_text: One of the most important lessons in this story is that this man exercised true faith in Jesus Christ and received a miracle because he asked with real intent , the real intent to follow Him.

speaker: Elder Massimo De Feo
title: Rise! He Calleth Thee
paragraph_text: And this is the ultimate reason for the blessings we receive in our lives, which is to follow Jesus Christ. It is about recognizing Him , making and keeping covenants with God because of Him , changing our very nature through Him , and enduring to the end by following Him .

speaker: Elder Massimo De Feo
title: Rise! He Calleth Thee
paragraph_text: For me, keeping a clear spiritual vision is all about focusing on Jesus Christ.

speaker: Elder Massimo De Feo
title: Rise! He Calleth Thee
paragraph_text: So is my spiritual sight clear as I get my eye injections? Well, who am I to say? But I am grateful for what I see.

speaker: Elder Massimo De Feo
title: Rise! He Calleth Thee
paragraph_text: I clearly see the hand of the Lord in this sacred work and in my life.

speaker: Elder Massimo De Feo
title: Rise! He Calleth Thee
paragraph_text: I see the faith of many wherever I go who strengthen my own faith.

speaker: Elder Massimo De Feo
title: Rise! He Calleth Thee
paragraph_text: I see angels all around me.

speaker: Elder Massimo De Feo
title: Rise! He Calleth Thee
paragraph_text: I see the faith of many who don’t see the Lord physically but recognize Him spiritually, because they know Him intimately.

speaker: Elder Massimo De Feo
title: Rise! He Calleth Thee
paragraph_text: I testify that this gospel is the answer for everything, because Jesus Christ is the answer for everyone. I am grateful for what I can see as I follow my Savior.

speaker: Elder Massimo De Feo
title: Rise! He Calleth Thee
paragraph_text: I promise that as we hear the voice of the Lord and allow Him to guide us on the Savior’s covenant path, we will be blessed with clear vision, spiritual understanding, and peace of heart and mind throughout our lives.

speaker: Elder Massimo De Feo
title: Rise! He Calleth Thee
paragraph_text: May we cry our testimony of Him louder than the voices around us in a world that needs to hear more of Jesus Christ and not less. May we remove the beggar’s coat that we might still wear and rise above the world to a better life in and through Christ. May we get rid of all excuses not to follow Jesus Christ and find all good reasons to follow Him as we hear His voice. This is my prayer in the name of Jesus Christ, amen.
